pros: Great people to work for. Very supportive in helping you achieve and set goals. Most people volunteer for non-profits, so getting paid to make a difference is nice. Doing events and so forth, you will be surrounded by positive people who want to make a difference. Best work culture I have experienced.
cons: Long-term employment generally relies on whether you find grants or funding for your salary, being that it is a non-profit. However, they've been working with funders and so forth for decades so you will have lots of support in finding those grants and funding.

pros: Values based job and some good staff
cons: Tense, underfunded, not able to evolve
